fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors

Class ActiveDataConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractConnector
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.AbstractDataConnector
        • fr.sorbonne_u.components.connectors.ActiveDataConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectorI, DataConnectorI, ComponentServiceI, DataOfferedI.PushI, DataRequiredI.PullI, RequiredI

    public abstract class ActiveDataConnector
extends AbstractDataConnector
    The class ActiveBasicDataConnector partially implements an active connector that can be used to connect qctive components in a synchronised way, on a mix of active and passive components using a full or partial pull mode. TODO: needs rethinking and redesign so to be used only when the two components use different push/pull mode so to connect them transparently.

    Description

    As there are two possible mode for transmitting data, push and pull, the connector establishes a two way connection between the two components, implementing the offering PushI interface with methods calling the requiring PushI and implementing the requiring PullI interface with methods calling the offering PullI one. A fully active connector has two threads: one to actively push data to the requiring component by calling its receive method, and one to actively pull data from the offering component by calling its get method. The connector acts as a bounded buffer between the two components. If the requiring component actively pull data from the connector, then the connector can be configured as a passive pusher, while if the offering component actively pushes data to the connector, then it can be configured as a passive puller. When the connector is configured as a passive pusher, then its implementation of the request method can be used by the requiring component to obtain new datum by accessing directly and synchronisely the buffer. In the same way, when the connector is configured as a passive puller, then its implementation of the send method can be used by the offering component to push new datum by putting them into the buffer in a synchronized way.

    Invariant

     invariant      isActivePuller => dataPuller != null
                                isActivePusher => dataPusher != null
                                                                                // TODO: to be completed...

    Created on : 2011-11-02

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      ActiveDataConnector(int bufferingCapacity)
      creates a new connector with some data buffer capacity, and with the default behavior of being both an active puller and pusher with minimum intervals between each push and each pull of 100 milliseconds.

      creates a puller thread that repeatedly calls the offering component to get a new datum that is then put into the data buffer, blocking if it is full.

      • ActiveDataConnector

        public ActiveDataConnector(int bufferingCapacity,
                           boolean isActivePuller,
                           int pullInterval,
                           boolean isActivePusher,
                           int pushInterval)
        creates a new active connector and fully configure it.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        bufferingCapacity - capacity of the data buffer.
        isActivePuller - true if the connector must be an active puller.
        pullInterval - minimum interval between pulls in milliseconds.
        isActivePusher - true if the connector must e an active pusher.
        pushInterval - minimum interval between pushes in milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • createPusherThread

        protected java.lang.Thread createPusherThread()
        creates a pusher thread that calls the requiring component to receive a datum when a new one is available in the data buffer, blocking if the buffer is empty. A new datum is pushed each pushInterval milliseconds, unless the data buffer is empty and then the pushing is delayed until a new datum becomes available in the data buffer.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        a pushing thread.

      • createPullerThread

        protected java.lang.Thread createPullerThread()
        creates a puller thread that repeatedly calls the offering component to get a new datum that is then put into the data buffer, blocking if it is full. A new datum is pulled each pullInterval milliseconds, unless the data buffer is full and then the pulling is delayed until space becomes available in the data buffer.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        a puller thread.

      • start

        public void start()
        starts the data pushing and data pulling threads depending on the configuration of the connector.

        Contract

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.

 post   true                            // no more postconditions.
